There are many movies that use voiceover narration effectively to enhance the storytelling, here are some examples:

1. The Godfather (1972) - The Godfather uses voiceover to provide context and backstory to the events of the movie, as well as to reveal the inner thoughts and feelings of the characters.

2. Fight Club (1999) - Fight Club employs voiceover to add a surreal and introspective tone to the film.

3. Goodfellas (1990) - Goodfellas uses voiceover to provide a retrospective and reflective insight into the life of Henry Hill, the gangster protagonist.

4. American Beauty (1999) - American Beauty features voiceover narration by the main character, which provides a critical and cynical commentary of suburban life.

5. Blade Runner (1982) - Blade Runner uses voiceover to provide a gritty and dystopian narration that adds to the film's futuristic atmosphere.

6. Forrest Gump (1994) - Forrest Gump uses voiceover narration by the titular character to express his innocence and unique perspective on life.

These are just a few examples of movies that use voiceover narration effectively. Each film uses voiceover in different ways to enhance the storytelling and create unique experiences for the audience.
